content:
I see that a Conv version of congr is already implemented. Since most of the code is there this is better suited to someone more familiar with the main developments.
Thanks @Mario Carneiro for your help. I will take this as a learning experience and make a fresh start on something else soon.
Siddhartha Gadgil has marked this topic as resolved.
The hope is that we can somehow mix and match the pieces that are already in lean 4 for doing congr stuff to get a tactic that acts like lean 3 congr
but it is true that it is not easy to jump into this code and find the right things to call
Yes, it does indeed look that way. But my familiarity with simp and related stuff is low, so not the right thing for me to take on right now.
The Conv.congr code is a lot simpler, but it doesn't seem to use congr lemmas, and it does not traverse into the head of an application like in your f x = g y example

I see. I will read the code a bit more and perhaps continue on this. Part of the reason for making a fresh start was that I had made the mistake of doing everything on my master branch, which would entangle this with other pull requests.
I have a fresh clone, and I will pull in what I did in a branch. If things are promising after my studying the code a bit, I will resume this.
